snippet: The state is poised to become the first to require all colleges receiving state funds to bolster their efforts and require that students give active consent before all sexual activity.
abstract: California is poised to become first state to require all colleges receiving state funds to strengthen their policies on sexual assault by mandating that students give active consent before all sexual activity.

byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The state is poised to become the first to require all colleges receiving state funds to bolster their efforts and require that students give active consent before all sexual activity.

headline.main: California Bill Sets Sights on Curbing Campus Sexual Assaults
headline.print_headline: California Bill Focuses on Curbing Campus Sexual Assaults
